titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4906) to amend the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to limit consideration of nonemergency matters in emergency legislation.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-690, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4906 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to the bill shall be in order except those printed in the report accompanying this resolution, if offered in the order and manner specified.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 209.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 8/9/1994--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 4906 (consideration of nonemergency matters in emergency spending legislation).
